body: I can take a look at this issue, but @cyrilthank can you please edit your report, make it more readable and remove the duplicate messages?

Thanks @ustcscgyer 

I am trying to figure out the best way to store the artifacts on the MLFlow server and the below is not working
can you please advise where i may find suitable examples of saving artifacts using the below schemes
'', 'file', 's3', 'gs', 'wasbs', 'ftp', 'sftp', 'dbfs', 'hdfs',

==============
import os
import mlflow
import mlflow.pyfunc

class AddN(mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel):

def __init__(self, n):
    self.n = n

def predict(self, context, model_input):
    return model_input.apply(lambda column: column + self.n)
model_path = "add_n_model"
add5_model = AddN(n=5)

tracking_uri="http://localhost:5000"
mlflowClient = mlflow.tracking.MlflowClient(tracking_uri)

experiment_to_run=mlflowClient.get_experiment_by_name("firstExperiment")
created_run=mlflowClient.create_run(experiment_to_run.experiment_id)

os.environ['MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI'] = tracking_uri
os.environ['MLFLOW_ARTIFACT_URI'] = tracking_uri

mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(
artifact_path="artifacts",
python_model=add5_model,
)

requesting since i start the MLtracking server using

mlflow server \
    --backend-store-uri file:/mlflowserver_backend_store_uri \
    --default-artifact-root ftp://cyril:cyril@localhost/mlflowserver_default_artifact_root \
    --host 0.0.0.0

The below
mlflowClient.create_run(experiment_to_run.experiment_id)
puts files into /mlflowserver_backend_store_uri
but artifacts are not pushed into the ftp location
Please advise

rename.from: How to store artifacts on a server running MLflow
rename.to: How to store artifacts on a server running MLflow instead of the mlruns directory in local server

body:
can you please advise me on what i may be doing wrong
since the below code creates the artifacts in the mlruns directory on local server

import mlflow
import mlflow.pyfunc
class AddN(mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel):
tracking_uri="file:///mlflowserver_default_artifact_root"
mlflowClient = mlflow.tracking.MlflowClient(tracking_uri)
experiment_id=mlflowClient.create_experiment("firstExperiment",tracking_uri)
experiments = [e.name for e in mlflowClient.list_experiments()]
experiment_to_run=mlflowClient.get_experiment_by_name("firstExperiment")
created_run=mlflowClient.create_run(experiment_to_run.experiment_id)
with mlflow.start_run() as run :
          mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(
          artifact_path="artifacts",
          python_model=add5_model,
          )

Requesting since i need to use 

mlflow.pyfunc.log_model 

  instead of 

mlflow.sklearn.log_model(lr, "model")

Hi @cyrilthank, I am a little bit confused by your question. In the beginning it seems that your problem was the `Could not find a registered artifact repository` error, then you updated the issue by saying that the artifact is not saved to the correct location. Does this mean you already resolved the issue you encounter in the beginning?

@cyrilthank I do not have a ftp site, but I have no problem to save my artifacts in the place specified by the mlflow server. Here is how I achieved it:

- step 1: Run the mlflow server:
```bash
 mlflow server --backend-store-uri ${mlruns_tracking} \
                         --default-artifact-root ${mlruns_artifacts}
```

- step 2: Record metrics and artifacts
```python
tracking_uri = 'http://localhost:5000'
mlflow.set_tracking_uri(tracking_uri)

print(mlflow.get_tracking_uri()) # This should be 'http://localhost:5000'
print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri()) # This should be '${mlruns_artifacts}/0/${uuid}/artifacts'
     
mlflow.log_metric('test_metric', 1)
mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(artifact_path="test_artifact",
                        python_model=add5_model)
```

After this you should find the metric in the store-uri folder, and the artifact in the artifact-root folder. Try to see if you can reproduce the same thing. In you original post, your artifact uri was wrong. 

Let me know if you still have questions.

Here is what i did

step 1 : 

lflow server \
    --backend-store-uri file:/mlflowserver_backend_store_uri \
    --default-artifact-root file:/mlflowserver_default_artifact_root \
    --host 0.0.0.0

Step 2:

import os
import mlflow

class AddN(mlflow.pyfunc.PythonModel):

    def __init__(self, n):
        self.n = n

    def predict(self, context, model_input):
        return model_input.apply(lambda column: column + self.n)

model_path = "add_n_model"
add5_model = AddN(n=5)


tracking_uri="http://localhost:5000"

mlflow.set_tracking_uri(tracking_uri)

print(mlflow.get_tracking_uri()) 
print(mlflow.get_artifact_uri()) 

mlflow.log_metric('test_metric', 1)
mlflow.pyfunc.log_model(artifact_path="test_artifact",
                        python_model=add5_model)

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.

Hello,
The artifact logging really doesn't work when the mlflow server is remote. The artifacts like models, conda file etc. are not logged remotely - only locally. The corresponding metric logging, on the other hand, is not a problem once you set the environment variable `MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI`.

Is something needs to be done on the client side apart from setting the env variable `MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI`? The documentation is quite unclear about this.
Thank you for interacting with this issue! Removing the stale label!

Thanks @sid for your response

I too am waiting for some clarity on the MLFLOW_TRACKING_URI
not sure how folks are using this in production/poc
I was able to make mlflow tracking work with kubeflow on GCP using nfs. The little mlflow trick was to use `mlflow.gt_artifact_uri`+`mlflow.keras.save_model` instead of `mlflow.keras.log_model`.
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
@sid027 Can you elaborate on that? I'm facing the same problem and I don't understand your solution.
